solution_line_template: If there are half as many VW Bugs as there are Toyota trucks in this parking lot, and there are {num_vw_bugs} VW Bugs, then there are {multiplier_for_toyota}*{num_vw_bugs}=<<{multiplier_for_toyota}*{num_vw_bugs}={num_toyota_trucks}>>{num_toyota_trucks} Toyota trucks in the parking lot.

And if there are twice as many Ford trucks as Toyota trucks in this parking lot, then there are {multiplier_for_ford}*{num_toyota_trucks}=<<{multiplier_for_ford}*{num_toyota_trucks}={num_ford_trucks}>>{num_ford_trucks} Ford trucks in the parking lot.

And if there are one-third as many Ford trucks as Dodge trucks in the parking lot, then there are {num_ford_trucks}*{multiplier_for_dodge}=<<{num_ford_trucks}*{multiplier_for_dodge}={num_dodge_trucks}>>{num_dodge_trucks} Dodge trucks in the parking lot of the Taco Castle.
